pageContext.claim: “Turkey also knows, because I got back Pastor Brunson, you remember that....I did a lot of damage to their currency in order to get him back. If we have to do something, if Turkey is out of line in what they are doing, really out of line, I will do something because our economy is so powerful now.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump imposed sanctions on Turkey to pressure for the release of Andrew Brunson, but it did not wipe out Turkey's economy. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan shrugged them off and imposed reciprocal sanctions on US officials: "Those who think that they can make Turkey take a step back with ridiculous sanctions have never known this country or this nation." Brunson was eventually released.
